author: seeohenareayedee
body: Stx any good? 5% dividend didn't seem to bad... Buy 100 shares and sell a covered call or nah?

author: MoesBAR
body: I bought Seagate too just in case but I really like WDs products, I do expect them to get a boost in memory sales with next gen consoles and PC gaming upgrades to keep up.

author: VolvoKoloradikal
Myweedalt
body: STX c or p?

author: lostcattears
body:
No, Did you not just read what i wrote? Intel was never a big part of cloud storage they were with their cpus. So their storage division was Never a concern to their profits. 

SK hynix on the other hand now gains a Huge advantage as they are one of the main competitoes against Western Digital and Micrion and seagate. Intel was Hardly ever in the compeition.

Sk hynix is now armed with a new weapon. That will be used until intel they hardly ever done anything with their storage division.

author: Awkward-Leopard-2683
body: What's the play on STX?

author: ghostcaurd
body: Vxx calls and stx puts. Let's see how this plays out

author: lostcattears
body:
HUH? what are you smoking what does that have to do with WDC. Intel was talking about their CPU not their storage... Intel really only sells CPU to data centers...

Intel JUST sold their storage division to sk hynix.

And if you are looking to the future. There was a post on the LTT forum saying Nand Flash prices are expecte to drop another  10-15% this new quarter and ANOTHEr 10-15% next quarter.

Not only that Seagate just reported a failed quarter dropping 6%. People also stop buyign Western digital products last quarter cuz of another false advertisement.

author: BkkPla
body: STX buys TSLA and F and GM and T - not, pump to 500$

author: Ironleg01
body:
* HDDs are legacy business with low margins
* Consumer sector revenues dropped after Covid because retail shops closed
* Massively in dept after buying ScanDisk. Like market cap is 11b and debt is 10b massive
* Had to completely stop dividend because of massive debt
* They have edge in producing SSD disks but for some reason Seagate is making SSD for new Xbox
* Few days ago got kicked out of NASDAQ 100 and replaced by fucking Dr Pepper Inc.
* Share price is 50% lower than fucking 5 years ago.

&#x200B;

Yep, sounds like perfect play for you. Max out whatever credit card they issue for people with bad credit score and go all in.

author: oppai_suika
body: Seagate is a better buy imo

author: nobodycaresaaaa
body: Is WDC their main competitor? I see Samsung, Toshiba, and Micron. But I think Seagate is the most popular for desktop PCs. If you think ppl went HAM on Corsair and Logitech stuff, the seagate SSD is fastest for consumer purposes. I’m bullish

author: BoardButcherer
body:
You're assuming that Seagate will get a proportionate share of those increases.

Their position in the industry does not guarantee that, and even makes it less likely. Western Digital earnings are on the 28th. If they smash their earnings, and Seagate is just okay or mildly good, Seagate is gonna tank.

author: GoldenPresidio
body: Pricing is NAND is like the wild wild west. This isn't like HDDs where there are only 3 manufacturers (Toshiba, Seagate, Western Digital) that just have implicit collusion on pricing.

author: bob6544
body: seagate $stx, earnings after close and they are projected to be down, but considering their drives are in the new xbox i don’t see any way they don’t beat. but i’m also a retard who’s desperate for a 10 bagger

author: ghostcaurd
body: Puts on seagate. Let's see if it breaks me

author: chris_kalan
body: Nahh, the RAM and SSDs are likely Samsung. Seagate doesn’t make the NAND flash themselves, and they’ve been the maker of Xbox drives for ages. Not likely to do much for the stock.

author: BoardButcherer
body:
WD is without question the industry leader in all categories except SSD's.

Seagate doesn't even make their own SSD's, their chips come from Kioxia, owned by Sandisk, and their controllers are either Sandforce or Kioxia. All they do is slap a sticker on it after some chinese factory sticks them together.

Seagate is also notorious for their regular press releases talking about how SSD's are just a fad and the future is all about platter HDD's. Trying to keep the air of bravado going in the face of impending doom because they don't have any prospect of buying their own SSD manufacturer, and won't make their own chip fab. All of their competitors are doing the opposite.

author: BoardButcherer
body:
https://blocksandfiles.com/2019/05/13/seagate-down-toshiba-up-in-q1-2019-hdd-market-share/

Seagate is a genuinely shitty company. I've lost a lot of data to them.

Their website says 22nd, Google says the 5th, RobinHood says 22nd.

Take your pick.
